content:
Test- and validator cases are not balanced. I got this as shortest, and of course I tried how far I could go with skimming the course names. I passed all tests. It is bullshit that then in the validator I am punished for this approach.

With the following code I passed all test cases:
x=input()[:3]
print([['false','backend'][x in'NodExpMySMon'],'frontend'][x in'HTMCSSJavBooTaiREAVueAng'])

Please either make sure to punish such code in the test cases, or change validators. It is absolutely not fair that in a random validator (eg validator 2), 'Java' is tested which should give false, (but if you use part of the names it gives a match with JavaScript), but that you have no such check in the test cases.

With current tests cases it's possible to pass all tests and still fail on validators.
If someone tries to find using the substring search, e.g. `"HTML, CSS, ...".find(input)"`, such solution will fail only on Validator #2.

âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: C'est simple, logique et clair. Elle reste trÃ¨s facile.

âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: J'ai mis en oeuvre mes notions de conditions et de Tableaux. La description et la logique me semble cohÃ©rente.

âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: Ã§a m'a fait codÃ© une multi ternaire Ã§a peut Ãªtre cool a apprendre
a lot of clash are easy too, i approuve

It's a nice motivation, but the actual clash is too simple to be fun in my opinion.

In fastest mode, this is so easy to understand and solve, that the winner will just be the one who skim reads quickest and who is able to convert the course lists into arrays quickly.

One way to make it slightly more 'code-y' would be to require the output to be a sentence about the input.
{Input} is a {frontend/backend} course
{Input} is not a recognized course

e.g. "HTML is a frontend course"

It's still very easy, but at least it requires a few more steps so that it doesn't end up being a clash that everyone solves in < 1 minute.

Binary output issue
* According to the contribution guidelines, binary output should be avoided for clashes. As your clash accepts only two possible answers (either "true" or "false"), it suffers from the binary output issue. Please change the output requirement so that there are more than two possible answers in total.

Goal section & Output section
* Please format the possible outputs of "true" and "false" as {{constants}}.

Thanks.
Thanks for the heads-up about the clash rules! Iâ€™ve updated the problem to fit the guidelines. If there are any other changes or suggestions you have, just let me know. Really appreciate your help!
Validators and test cases are not balanced. Please check that before approving. In the validator, part of one of the existing courses is tested ('Java'), while this does not happen in the test cases.
Validators and test cases are not balanced. Please check that before approving. In the validator, part of one of the existing courses is tested ('Java'), while this does not happen in the test cases.
Validators and test cases are not balanced. Please check that before approving. In the validator, part of one of the existing courses is tested ('Java'), while this does not happen in the test cases.

Thank you too.

As mentioned, please format the possible outputs as {{constants}}. Hence,
â€¢ "frontend" should be changed to {{frontend}},
â€¢ "backend" should be changed to {{backend}},
â€¢ "false" should be changed to {{false}},
the quotation marks are removed at the same time.

Thanks again.

Sorry I missed that in your first comment! I've now updated the outputs to use {{constants}} as you mentioned.

If there's anything else you need or any other adjustments, just let me know. Thanks for your patience and help!
Now please do the same changes in Goal section as mentioned ðŸ˜‰
